Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of the Thai Translation of the Aberdeen Varicose Vein Questionnaire

Participants.evidence: Participants included adults with CEAP C2-C6 and truncal reflux.

Intervention.evidence: Venous interventions were performed, and outcomes were measured using AVVQ-Thai, VCSS, and EQ-5D pre- and one-month post-intervention.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to translate the Aberdeen Varicose Vein Questionnaire into Thai (AVVQ-Thai) and evaluate its reliability, validity, and minimal clinically important differences (MCID) in patients with chronic venous disease (CVD).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the change in AVVQ-Thai scores.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 119 patients were included.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Median AVVQ scores improved significantly post-intervention from 15.4 to 4.2 in C2-C3 and from 18.9 to 7.3 in C4-C6.
